newsitem.title: UK: IPE gas oil closes firmer, underpinned by heating.
newsitem.headline: IPE gas oil closes firmer, underpinned by heating.

text.p: IPE gas oil closed $1 a tonne stronger on Friday having been dragged up by NYMEX heating oil.

May ended the session at $163.25 a tonne having gained most of its momentum after NYMEX opened. Only minutes after NYMEX opened gas oil made its intra-day high of $165.00, but prices slipped during the course of the afternoon.
Traders said gas oil was playing second fiddle to U.S heating which was in the energy complex driving seat. Heating oil was up 0.55 cents at 54.55 cents a gallon at 1745 GMT.
"Its still heating which is uncomfortably carrying the mantle. It really should be gasoline by now," said one trader.
Heating oil was supported by colder than normal weather in the key U.S northeast United States which has resulted in supply tightness.
May gas oil was seen as having good support at $160.00 and fairly stern resistance at $166.50.
June Brent was 28 cents firmer at $17.97 a barrel having drifted off a high of $18.13, achieved shortly after NYMEX opened. Traders said resistance once $18.00 was breached was around $18.05-18.11.
